intro: Pulsatilla oenipontana, commonly known as the meadow anemone, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Ranunculaceae family, characterized by its showy, cup-shaped flowers that typically bloom in early spring. The plant has a short, hairy stem and palmate leaves that are divided into several lobes. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges. Its flowers are usually pink or white, and it produces follicles that contain the seeds.
